events.name: Security Wednesdays #11 - "The Defcon 24 Experience & Life at Security Internships"
events.description:
The DEFCON 24 Experience
------------------------
What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas... except for what we'll be sharing during this talk! Some of us at the Greyhats were in Sin City for the plethora of information security conferences this summer. The highlight of our trip was the infamous DEFCON hacker conference. In this casual session, we'll provide a glimpse into the hacker subculture we immersed ourselves in at DEFCON as well as BSides Las Vegas and Blackhat Las Vegas.

Life at Security Internships
----------------------------
Have you ever wondered what a security internship is like? Or about the various companies where a security internship is available? For this Security Wednesday, we will be having a sharing session where members of the Core Team will discuss about their security related internships with companies like Google, FireEye, MWR Labs, DSO and CSIT.
We will also be having a Q&A afterwards.

Speakers
----------------------------
The Greyhats Core Team will be there to share more about both the DEFCON 24 experience and how it is like at different security internships. 

Stand a chance to win a free NUS Greyhats T-shirt at our Security Wednesdays! Simply come down to find out out more about how you can get yours too!
events.location: NUS School of Computing COM1 02-04 Seminar Room 2, , Singapore

events.name: Inaugural Meetup
events.description:
There will be Pizza's! For Who? If you are... • DevOps savvy and want to improve your work flow • Play with Docker and want to take it to the next level • Tried out creating your own Kubernetes cluster and don't know what's next Tentative Agenda :  We will start early (6:30pm) with an introduction to Kubernetes for new comers while people familiar with Kubernetes can come in at their own time to enjoy networking at the pantry. We'll start the more advanced session by 7:30pm - feel free to come in by that time. • 6:30 - 6:50 pm @ Theatre- Introduction to Kubernetes for new comers. • 6:30 - 7:15 pm @ Pantry - Come on in + networking • 7.20 - 8:05 pm @ Theatre - Centralised Logging and powerful Visualisations with ES+Kibana on Kubernetes - by Vincent De Smet, Honestbee •  You got your Kubernetes cluster, now what? One of the first things you may be interested to know is how to centralise the logs of all these containers being scheduled across your nodes. We will be doing a deep dive into the Logging infrastructure that comes with the standard provisioning scripts and how we can iterate upon them to achieve centralised logging and powerful visualisations. • 8:15 - 8:45 pm -  Terraform vs Chef/Ansible - by Charles Martinot, Honestbee • What is the difference between Terraform and Chef/Ansible, what can Terraform bring to your organisation? This talk will show you how to use it to be able to create entire stacks in cloud providers in a matter of minutes. • 9:45 pm - User stories - what is the community up to (Feel free to ping us if you have suggestions for a talk/topic) or Stay and mingle in the beautiful venue provided by Honestbee  if you would like to give a talk, please come forward. Suggested topics: - CloudNativeDay.org recap ... - CoreOS tools (Etcd3, Ignition, Torus, ..) - Latest Hashicorp Announcements (Consul Transactions, Terraform imports, ...) - .. suggestions welcome 


PS: We didn't enable the feature to add guest, please ask your friends to join the group so we can keep track of attendees easier - thanks :D
events.location: Honestbee, #04-01B Delta House, 2 Alexandra Road, 159919, Singapore

events.name: Are You Ready To Be A Coder?
events.description:
Technology has changed the ways we live and work. Some say learning how to code is as important as learning how to read and write. If you are interested in learning coding, or maybe a career as a software developer, this workshop would be perfect for you. [ Who should join ] 。Students who want to learn coding 。Career Switchers 。Aspiring entrepreneurs [ What you will learn ] 。Learn the qualities to be a coder 。Learn the best practice of coding 。Attempt some coding for yourself [ Workshop details ] 。Date: 31 Aug 。Time: 7.30 - 9.30pm 。Venue: 99 Duxton [ Instructor ] Kale Toh Software Engineer, Singapore Tourism Board Over 7 years of software development experience. Previously iOS Development Instructor at ALPHA Camp and The Pragmatic Lab. Passionate in teaching and solving problems with code. 


*** This is a PAID event. Kindly register and pay directly at https://dojo.alphacamp.co/events/are-you-ready-to-be-a-coder-2.
